answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.The symptom described by you could be due to neuropathy. It is a disorder of the nerves which causes numbness, tingling, unusual sensations and sometimes pain. Diabetes Mellitus can cause neuropathy. Other causes like vitamin deficiencies, alcohol consumption and certain medications can cause neuropathy. Check to rule out Diabetes Mellitus. This can be detected by a simple blood test.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: I am a 31 year old female with hypertension and am 24 weeks pregnant.  This all started about 7 months ago ( before I was pregnant).  I woke up one morning and my face was tight/ numbish.  It got worse throughout the day and I went to the ER where they did a CT scan (normal), blood work (normal), ekg (normal),...my bp was a bit elevated, but as I was on Licinapril, my bp had been well controlled for 3weeks and the best answers were either a reaction to the meds or MS or stress.  (Quite a range of dx's)My PCP took me off Licinapril and put me on Labetalol (it had worked durring my second pregnancy) and concured with the sress theory.   He did have me wear a halter monitor for 24 hours which also showed normal results.The facial numbness never went away for more than a few hours at a time, but started switching sides and coming and going.  I started having headaches, which I never had before.   Then I got pregnant on accident and soon after started another symptom.  I felt tingles/prickles all over....every side, all parts....sometimes just one prickle, sometimes lots of prickles.  It got worse in the heat.Then I had a numb patch below my right knee that would be the size of a quarter or spread to the whole knee and shin, then reduce again.  This felt like my face.  I could still feel the affected area, but it felt tight and strange.Then came the buzzing...in my left knee, my left hip, my right hip, my right foot.....a pulsating vibration...on for two seconds, off for five seconds.  Not all at once....the location changed over time with an episode not lasting longer than two weeks at the most....usually three days.most of these symptoms have eased up or disappeared.  But i still have the facial numbness that comes and goes and brings with it a heck of a headache.  The headache feels dull all over but feels sharp and stabbing around my eyes and small, specific parts of my head.  I see sparkles and feel terrible.....and, yet my bp is 115/65.I saw a neuro who said he cant do anything for me until I have the baby.  He did get me an EEG which was normal, B12 which was 525, and Lyme which was neg.   My PCP thinks it is all stress and my OB is not concerned.  Does this sound like anything?  Migraines? Seisures? MS?  or is it all in my head?  I am so frustrated and have been realitively healthy my whole life.  What has changed so suddenly that I am now feeling so strange?   Please help!
title: migraines?
